Ready to journey from Chennai to the stunning region of Kashmir? Our meticulously crafted tour package promises an adventure filled with breathtaking landscapes, rich culture, and thrilling activities. Choose from flying, traveling by train, or driving for a seamless and enriching experience.

Why Choose Kashmir for Your Next Vacation?

Kashmir, known as “Heaven on Earth,” is famous for its majestic scenery. Imagine snow-capped mountains, lush valleys, and shimmering lakes – a perfect blend of beauty and tranquility. The region’s vibrant culture and warm hospitality make it an ideal destination for both relaxation and adventure.

Highlights of Our Kashmir Tour Packages from Chennai to Kashmir

Traveling from Chennai to Kashmir offers an incredible journey through the length of India, covering a wide variety of landscapes, cultures, and climates. Here’s a guide to help you understand how to reach Kashmir from Chennai:

1. By Air (Fastest):

  • Route: Chennai International Airport (MAA) to Srinagar Airport (SXR) or Jammu Airport (IXJ).
  • Duration: 3–5 hours (non-stop or with a layover).
  • Layovers: Most flights have layovers in Delhi or Mumbai.
  • Best for: Saving time and maximizing your stay in Kashmir.

Booking Links Flexible Transportation Options

  • IndiGo
  • SpiceJet
  • GoAir
  • Air India

2. By Train (Scenic & Cost-effective):

  • Route:
    1. Chennai Central (MAS) to Jammu Tawi (JAT).
    2. Jammu Tawi to Srinagar by road (about 8 hours).
  • Duration: Approximately 50–60 hours from Chennai to Jammu.
  • Popular Trains:
    1. Andaman Express
    2. Himsagar Express
  • Best for: Travelers who want to enjoy the changing landscapes from the southern plains to the northern mountains
  • Booking Links
    • Indian Railways

3. By Road (Adventurous):

  • Route:
    • Chennai to Delhi via NH44 or NH48.
    • Delhi to Jammu and further to Srinagar or other parts of Kashmir.
  • Distance: Around 3,700 km.
  • Duration: 4-6 days, depending on stops.
  • Best for: Adventure seekers who love long road trips and want to explore multiple states on the way.
  • Booking Links for Taxis and Buses
    • Makemytrip
    • Redbus
    • Goibibo

Recommended Option:

If time is a priority, flying is the most efficient way to travel. If you prefer a scenic journey, consider taking the train or driving, especially for the last leg from Jammu to Srinagar, which offers beautiful views of the Himalayas.

Make sure to check the latest travel advisories and road conditions, especially in the winter, as some routes in Kashmir can be affected by snow.

Our Detailed Itinerary

Day 1: Arrival in Srinagar

  • Welcome at Srinagar Airport
  • Transfer to a luxurious houseboat on Dal Lake
  • Evening Shikara ride on the lake
  • Overnight stay in the houseboat

Day 2: Srinagar City Tour

  • Visit the famous Mughal Gardens: Shalimar Bagh, Nishat Bagh, and Chashme Shahi
  • Tour the old city and explore local crafts markets
  • Overnight in Srinagar hotel

Day 3: Excursion to Gulmarg

  • Scenic drive to Gulmarg known for its beautiful landscapes and ski resorts
  • Gondola ride to Apharwat Peak
  • Optional skiing or snowboarding
  • Return to Srinagar for the night

Day 4: Pahalgam Sightseeing

  • Drive to Pahalgam, a picturesque town on the Lidder River
  • Visit local sites like Betaab Valley and Aru Valley
  • Enjoy local activities like horse riding or trekking
  • Stay overnight in Pahalgam

Day 5: Visit to Sonamarg

  • Day trip to Sonamarg, the “Meadow of Gold”
  • Activities like pony rides to Thajiwas Glacier
  • Return to Srinagar for overnight stay

Day 6: Departure

  • Transfer to the airport for your return flight to Chennai

FAQs

What is the best time to visit Kashmir for adventure activities?

The ideal time to visit Kashmir for adventure activities is from March to October for summer activities and December to February for winter sports.

Are there any safety precautions for adventure activities in Kashmir?

Yes, it is essential to follow safety guidelines provided by instructors and guides, wear appropriate gear, and be aware of weather conditions.

Can beginners try adventure activities in Kashmir?

Absolutely! Kashmir offers a range of activities suitable for beginners, including skiing, trekking, and rafting with professional guidance.

What should I pack for an adventure trip to Kashmir?

Pack appropriate clothing for the season, sturdy shoes, safety gear for specific activities, and essential items like sunscreen, a first-aid kit, and a water bottle.

Are there any restrictions for adventure activities in Kashmir?

Certain activities may have age or health restrictions. It’s best to check with the activity providers for specific requirements.
